subject: Education
title: Unschooling: Learning Without Curriculum
description: A quick win: understand Unschooling: Learning Without Curriculum.

hook.text: Some families let children decide what, when, and how they learnâ€”with no curriculum at all.

buildup.text: John Holt coined 'unschooling' in the 1970s, arguing that children are natural learners.

discovery.text: Unschoolers follow curiosity: a child obsessed with dinosaurs studies paleontology deeply.

twist.text: Critics worry about gaps. Advocates say passion-driven learning fills them naturally.

climax.text: Research is limited, but case studies show many unschoolers thrive in college and careers.

punchline.text: The most radical education idea is trusting the learner completely.

quiz.question: What defines unschooling as an educational approach?
options: Children direct their own learning based on curiosity with no set curriculum
Students attend school only on weekends
Parents teach a strict classical curriculum at home
